msg:
Section View is a powerful tool that allows users to view sections of interest either as table or as text and also see difference between multiple versions of a set of sections.

In Table view, you can filter section data by rows or columns, transpose views, and group and order them in a way that is meaningful to a specific problem, and more importantly, to save the view.

This saved view can then be applied to any log bundle from any device, to help the support teams to quickly view the relevant parts of the log represented in a format that enables quicker troubleshooting.

Type the letters of the particular section name you are looking for.

The section list automatically filters as you key in the letters.
You can run you previously saved Section Views here. And you can set a a view as private or public or run a saved section views of your peers from here.

When you click the View Sections/Diff icon from Log Vault on a selected Log Bundle, you will by default land in the Table view.

You can show/hide columns, filter column data, transpose data, add/remove sections, or donwload a log bundle.

In addition, you can save your customized table view for reference later.

When you click on the section name from the results in Explorer, you will by default land in Log view.

You can switch to the Table view from here or if you land in the Table view, you can switch to the Log View too.

You can open multiple Log Bundles at the same time, as each Section view opens in its own page/instance.

Since the data is represented as text, there are limited operations allowed in this view.
This App helps you view changes in the log file for a selected device from a previous log generated by the same system.

In all the three views (Table, Log, and Diff) you can mouse over the information icon (i) on the navigation bar.

This provides information on the Serial Number, log bundle name, and the latest observation date of the log bundle.
When multiple sections have been selected, using this option to filter data across all the sections using attributes that are common to all sections.
Use this button save a custom section view and if you want to reuse a view on a particular log bundle.

If you need to share the Section View to peers or customers for offline analysis, you can export the view to a pdf report.

Downloading data in PDF will export all the sections selected.
Click to rest the custom filters options you have applied and return to the default view.
You can download the log bundle which contains the file that you are viewing.
